alert.note: Alert for Cook; DuPage (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 17 at 7:26AM CDT until September 17 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Cook County in northeastern Illinois... Eastern DuPage County in northeastern Illinois... * Until 130 PM CDT Sunday. * At 726 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are likely in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, Bolingbrook, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Oak Park, Downers Grove, Elmhurst, Lombard, Ohare Airport, Park Ridge, Addison, Elk Grove Village, Woodridge, Midway Airport, Austin, South Lawndale, Chicago Lawn, Irving Park and West Town. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
